meta.description: There are two coal mines, A and B, with monthly coal supplies of at least 80 tons and 100 tons, respectively. They are responsible for supplying coal to three residential areas, which require 55 tons, 75 tons, and 50 tons of coal per month, respectively. The distances between mine A and these three residential areas are 10 kilometers, 5 kilometers, and 6 kilometers. The distances between mine B and these three residential areas are 4 kilometers, 8 kilometers, and 15 kilometers. How should these two coal mines distribute the coal to the three residential areas to minimize the ton-kilometers of transportation?

params.name: supply
params.description: Monthly coal supply from each mine

params.name: demand
params.description: Monthly coal demand for each residential area

params.name: distance
params.description: Distances from mines to residential areas

vars.name: x
vars.description: Amount of coal transported from mine to residential area

objective.name: min_transport_cost
objective.expr: quicksum(distance[m][r] * x[m][r] for m in M for r in R)
objective.description: Minimize the total transportation cost in ton-kilometers

constraints.description: Demand constraint for residential area R1

constraints.description: Demand constraint for residential area R2
